message: i wish there was an option to change the conversion bit rate to something like 160 or 192 kbps.
yeah, then i could have my entire collection in apple lossless, and convert to 256k for listening on my ipod classic
@italiano40 well, sure, you can do that in itunes... though i'm not sure what "hardly any loss" means
@kyserboy maybe start a new topic? people probably aren't going to see that question here
@italiano40 which software? it's been a long time since i used anything except itunes to rip my music... i'd be interested if there have been advancements

@djchall i know itunes can do it, but there are better software that are at the core doing that and that can take a 320kbps and make it a 192kpbs with out making it sound that much different <<basic explanation don't want to type out a huge essay LOL
@danT i use another convertor to get higher bit rates there are a ton that will do it
Do anyone have Skype on Ipad if so I was wondering can it be running in the background and still say Online
@djchall that will take a bit rate like 320kbps and bring it to 192kpbs with hardly any loss

@italiano40 yes, there are tons of converters, but that's different than what i am talking about.  im not talking about the original import of the music to my itunes library.  rather, im talking about automatically syncing my current library of songs (encoded @ 256kbps) with an ipot at a bit rate of 192 kbps.
@danT so you want it to encoded it on the fly to a 192 kbps while putting it on the ipod but keep in tact the library encoding?

@italiano40 yes.  i want my library to stay encoded at 256kbps, but i want itunes to sync all those songs to my ipod at the different rate of 192kbps.  however, itunes currently only lets you do this with the sync set at 128kbps and doesnt give you the option of making it higher.
